Personally, even though I have bought many skins "rare" or "limited edition" (or both), I feel like the value has been lost in time. Skins that were limited to that period of time, have become available to everyone (therefor), losing value. 

To me, I think that there should be more skins that are "If you aren't there during the time, you can't get it" sort of thing, and to keep that rareness and "limited edition/legacy" touch for real. So for Championship Riven, as rare and epic as the skin is. I'd feel it would keep the true value for skin itself, and if even the slightest bit possible, stop putting legacies out there for the rest of us. Maybe start selling skins that are "one time" only to give it true rareness and for us Gamers who spend time and money to get these.

And with that, whatever you do now will determine whether or not this skin will keep its popularity among the community. So please, choose carefully what will happen to this skin.

I want an equal opportunity as those who had first purchased it ( In the store) so that I can enjoy the same privileges as them. It's genuinely not fair that I can't buy a skin simply because I hadn't started playing yet and others can, simply because they had. Here's my idea. I believe that you should make this skin legacy and bring it back every year, only on worlds, as that would maintain its 'rarity' and provide everyone with an equal opportunity to purchase it.

Honestly, do not re-release Championship Riven, these types of skins should be a reward for competitions / ladder play. If you missed out, sign up for the next one with a team/solo, try and do well and improve. Stop bending to the pressure of those who don't have it, i don't have it. I like the skin, i like the fact i can't acquire it. It makes me look to the upcoming events and rewards with more interest and makes me contemplate participating. And isn't that what the gaming community about ultimately? Creating positive growth so you as a company have a business and livelihood and we the users a product we enjoy and a way to compete and relax whilst being rewarded?  

And no, Hextech annie is not a replacement for your championship riven or a bonus, because then the reason for hextech annie is pointless.

Zal has a point, throw it into the Hextech crafting system, maybe another target for 10 gems, i disagree giving those gems to people whom already have Champ riven, you're just giving them a bonus skin. However the best method whilst still making it extremely rare, and well, doing what a business should... boosting sales in a way thats fun for the consumer. Because at present, you're limiting yourself with RP income atm with mystery champ shard release, you may counter it a bit with RP purchases for hextech chests, but i guessing your revenue went down the last 4weeks, not up. How to fix that? 

If you're really set on re-releasing championship riven to the general public for no effort. Hextech loot system would be best.

edit;
p.s- Hextech Annie is very underwhelming for the difficulty it is. Collectors only do it for the show off value, and even then... it's more like "congratulations on spending a couple of hundred dollars on RP". needs to be a bit balanced i think, im guessing the gemstone drop rate is around 3-5% chance per chest as thats roughly the stats im (probably closer to 5-7% havent done the total math, around 25-35 chests opened and only had 3, which i turned into more chests because... Who GIAF about hextech annie other than show off value?

I'm a bit confused as to why you think Championship Riven should be a reward for being good at League. All of the Championship skins are made as a celebration of the end of a season. What you're thinking of are VICTORIUS skins, which are only available to players who achieve Gold V and up at the end of the season. I think they should re-release this skin, as well as the other Championship skins, at the end of each season, just like they re-release Harrowing skins for the Harrowing and Challenger skins at the beginning of a new season (BTW they made Challenger Ahri available again this year, so it makes no sense not to make Championship skins available).

Well the time between Challenger Ahris release and Championship Rivens release is drastic. Comparing a skin released again a year after being made to a skin made around 4 years ago is laughable. I wasn't really a fan of the re-release of the Harrowing skins, even with the original people getting the border and icon. That isn't really much of a rebate for losing the rarity of an item. Also adding it to hextech crafting I think isn't a good idea because I just generally think the skin shouldn't be obtainable anymore.

To be honest, I don't think rarity means anything at all in this game. 1. Bragging about having a 'rare' skin isn't very nice, and is likely to leave a sour taste in your teammates' mouth. I also don't think people even care unless they were interested in the skin themselves, and if they are, it's kind of not right they can't buy it because they didn't even know the game existed (applicable for the really old skins) or just weren't able to at the time for whatever reason. 2. Considering you can't sell second-hand skins in this game, having a 'rare' skin means nothing at all. It's not like if they re-release a skin, a person will pay any less than you did. That said, I realise people bought accounts that might have contained said rare skins. Account selling and buying is illegal however, so it's their fault for breaking the law in the first place.

It's not like they're releasing Victorious skins, which actually required effort to obtain. All that was special about Championship skins is that you had RP in your account when it was released. That's it. You didn't have to get to Diamond or win 1000 games in two weeks or whatever.

What about those that didnt have to spend anything to get hextech annie? I got her in my 3rd or 4th free chest. I spent about $10 on getting more chests to gets the essences to permanently unlock it. 9also got a second shard of it in the process as well)

Oh please. you're just trying to be selfish, get over yourself and learn how to share. This skin is not a reward. It's for everyone. Just because you started playing in season 2, does not mean you're more worth than any of the other LoL players.  Do you realise how difficult it is to get championship riven in a hex tech crafting system. Just fuck what others say and simply place it in the LoL store. This is only a skin, why should i have to pay $300+ for a skin others got for 975 RP($10). Absolute BS. Here's my advice. Stop being so selfish. You have the skin and that's great, however that rest of us want an equal chance to that skin. If you were on our side of the argument. (Ie. you don't have the skin) then your argument would completely change. You don't understand what it's like to want something and be denied every right to it. Or even wanting something and having the slimmest chance at actually getting it. All of those whom already have this skin, excluding those who won it at last worlds, did not have to work a day in their lives to get it, you guys just don't realise how lucky you are to have that skin. IDGAF how rare it is. Skins should not be concealed from us. To conceal a skin and only make it available to the lucky few who somehow knew about the game in season 2 is very unethical. Re- evaluate your decision to place it in hex tech crafting, that only makes it that much worse for those who really want it. Taunting us with a slim to none chance at obtaining the skin whilst flaunting it in front of us is torture. Please just make it an in game/ store purchase so we can just end this dispute. And if that doesn't convince you, then an easy way to maintain its rarity would be to make it a legacy skin like the rest of the championship skins. Why should championship riven, literally the only skin I want, be unavailable to me or so difficult to obtain it might as well be, when you can simply make it a legacy skin, This therefore promotes a sense of rarity as well as allowing those who missed out on a chance to obtain the skin, a chance to obtain it every year, like the other championship skins.

With that argument, why can't I buy a house for the same price as they were back in the 1960's (with inflation and all adjusted)? You are also speaking like you have some kind of right to the skin, when in fact you don't. You also say we don't know what it's like to want something and not have it, well I'm sure everyone has had this. You can't say that you don't have the same opportunities as the people who bought it because there are people who are born into poverty and war. They never had the "Opportunities" you had, never in their lives would they think they would argue over a virtual item. Missing an opportunity is a problem everyone faces but you can't just complain about it till you get it. I didn't get the chance to get URF Warwick and I really want it too, but it doesn't mean I should be able to get it just like the people who bought it ~4 years ago.
